headline: Quesadilla Salvadoreña
description: Quesadilla Salvadoreña is a sesame seed-topped sweet bread made with Parmesan cheese that's commonly served with coffee for breakfast or as a snack.
name: Quesadilla Salvadoreña
recipeIngredient: 1 (4 ounce) package Parmesan cheese, finely grated
1 tablespoon sesame seeds, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until firm but not stiff.

Combine sugar and melted butter in a large bowl; beat on high speed until creamy. Mix in egg yolks until well blended. Gradually mix in Parmesan cheese. Add sour cream and baking powder; beat until batter is smooth.
Sift rice flour over batter, then fold it in with a spatula. Fold in egg whites.
Pour batter into a 9x13-inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 38 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made changes. Mixed half rice flour half biquick flour. Didn't seperate eggs. Did lazy method. Used 1/4 tsp baking soda 1/2 tsp vinegar because I didn't have baking powder. Still great.
Love this recipe!
Delicious lo mejor de lo mejor

I have made this three times in the past week and a half! My Salvadoran husband loves it! He eats it with his morning coffee, he eats it as a dessert. Easy recipe, I didn’t have rice flour, but all purpose seems to do well. Thank you!

I haven’t made it yet! Lol but I’ve been searching for my mom’s recipe that she figured out here in the U.S. (we are Salvadoran) and this looks like it almost to the T! So, I will make it for my son’s b-day to go along with pupusas we are buying thank you so much!!!!

For the most part, I followed the recipe. I added a little more cheese and a bit more sesame seeds. Needless to say, the quesadillas did not last very long in my home. My husband is from El Salvador and I'm Puerto Rican/American. My kids get both cultures this way.
Fan-freaking-tastic!
Cheese and cream have to be Salvadoreño for the right flavor. Aside from that, it’s the perfect recipe.

Very impressed finding this here! Very similar to my Grandmothers recipe! I would go more authentic though and seek out traditional cheese. Parmesan contains the salty savory tones of Salvadoran cheese, but not it’s flavor. Try “queso duro or duro viejo” , queso duro salvadoreño and Creme
One of the best recipes I have tried!

I’m Salvadoran and this reminds me of my grandma so much! She used to make it with feta cheese, so I decided to give it a try even though I had parmesan cheese at hand. It was delicious!! Thanks for this recipe I won’t need to buy it at the Latin supermarket anymore!!
The recipe is on point, as this quesadilla is by far the best I tasted in years. So glad I made it for my family. Everyone is raving about it and having seconds.
Absolutely delicious! I subbed cotija (1/2 cup) for the Parmesan and it was amazing. My husband loved it! Will be making this again and again!
Such a good recipe I can't get enough of it!
Awesome. Just like my husband’s family makes it.

Ok, I was not very confident going into this recipe, BUT OMG IT IS SO MOIST AND DELICIOUS AND RICH!! I love it and so did my children and husband. I did exactly what is written on the recipe, except that I added a little bit of vanilla extract and added a little bit of raisins the bottom of the pan because I don’t like sesame seeds. I sprayed the aluminum pan with a spray that had a little flour in it so it wouldn’t stick and it is perfect and delicious!! Thank you so much for sharing it with us!! Will be making it for church whenever we can meet again! I’m Dominican but I thought I’d give this a try! Our church is a Hispanic congregation, so I know they will enjoy it very much! I mean, who wouldn’t?!! Thank you!!
My first go at trying to make this was a super success. My husband love quesadilla but he can be very picky and even he loved it.
I see why this is a five star recipe! I have been looking for an authentic Quesadilla and this is it. I personally find it a little too buttery for my taste, so I'll reduce by a tablespoon or two.
This is just like the ones I had in El Salvador! It's the perfect comfort food for my boyfriend, who is from ES. It's sooo good! Thank you for posting!
Traditional Salvadorean recipe for quesadilla, can’t go wrong with these ingredients, you will enjoy it.
Perfectly yummy :)

I married into a Salvadorean family. My mother in law was a great cook. I have some hard shoes to fill. Unfortunately she passed away right when my now husband and I were dating. I felt awkward asking for her recipes when she was ill and in her death bed. Ive made this recipe for the whole family and they all LOVE it. My husband now said that this is his favorite recipe and always compares ANY quesadilla to this one. I thank you from the bottom of my heart for this recipe that even some Salvi family members have asked me to share with them. The instructions are so simple. Once again thank you so much
Really loved this! I didn’t have sour cream so I used cream cheese but only 2 oz. came out yummy! Thank you for this recipe!
Thank you so much for sharing your recipe!! It was easy to make and delicious to eat. Que rico !!

This is a very very authentic recipe, I’m El Salvadoran and I make this for my family all the time and I get request for it even more often. It’s a hit every. Single. Time. I will hold on to this recipe forever.

I doubled the recipe this time around and my husband (whom is Salvadoran) Loves it, even our picky daughter loves it and she is the one who usually never tries different foods. Thank you so much sharing
I tried it, very easy to make and yummy!
Best recipe ever

My family LOVES when I make these quesadillas for them. Best recipe for authentic quesadillas hands down. I was so upset when I couldn’t find your website anymore. I searched far and wide trying to find this recipe again. Alas, your recipe and I are reunited. Thank you! 

I’m first generation Salvadoran American and being able to make this treat for my aunts and uncles really bonds us together. ??
I surprised my wife is from El Salvador and made this quesadilla and she absolutely loved this authentic taste of her county. Cheers for the recipe! Thanks again.
Is this a finger food
Absolutely delicious, I have made this many of times and it comes out perfect every time.

Really simple recipe with great flavor. My husband(who is not from El Salvador) likes it better than the ones sold at el Salvadoran restaurants. I’ve made it several times now and it’s become a family favorite.

This looks fabulous--thank you for sharing! One question I need to make it the night before for my son's presentation on El Salvador--do I need to refrigerate it overnight before serving in the morning?
This was amazing! Super easy to make and very delicious. Tastes just like the one my mom used to make.

Delicious and authentic recipe! My mother's side of the family is from El Salvador. I recently moved from Los Angeles to a town in Oregon without any Saldadorean bakeries. It came out perfectly. I ended up doing a repeat 2 days later because everyone loved it!. Best and easiest recipe for quesadilla around.
Delish! My husband is from Honduras and recognized it immediately without me having to tell him what I attempted to make! Haha

I've made this twice now and both results were awesome. The first time I made it I actually used all-purpose flour and I loved it. My husband was on the fence. The second time I used rice flour and he loved it (I actually preferred the first). 

Most people haven't heard of this bread and I took it to work and my coworkers loved it. 

Good job on the directions- found easy to follow.
The recipe was easy to follow and it turned out fantastic! I used a combination of parmesean and cojita cheese. This will definitely be made again soon!

I don't know the first thing about making these traditional Salvi quesadillas. Since I happen to be married to a Salvadorean, I do know when they are good and not good. 
I came across this recipe and decided to make it. Folks, let me tell you that this is the real deal! It came out so moist and fluffy and not too sweet. And it was just as good the next day. I made the big 9x13 last night, and everyone just devoured it! 

Gracias Cipota!

What a deliciously different treat. I will admit after the first bite, my taste buds were very confused, but not negatively. Parmesan, sugar butter.. dessert. I liked this a lot.. will make again. I did use greek yogurt instead of sour cream since I had that.. came out fine
